As our country continues to face major challenges I will work my hardest to ensure we have a government of by and for the people that advances fairness justice and a decent quality of life for every family and every community.
I am deeply grateful to the voters for re-electing me to Maryland's 3rd Congressional District. https://t.co/H0GDsPUVIo
I will work tirelessly to deliver justice equality and opportunity for every community in Maryland and across the country. #SarbanesForMaryland https://t.co/hHwu7gKLql
I remain laser focused on protecting the Chesapeake Bay and taking swift action to tackle the climate crisis. #ActOnClimate #SarbanesForMaryland https://t.co/1pp7r1N0rm
Hearing directly from people like you helps me better represent our state and has shaped my work in Congress. #SarbanesForMaryland

I have the unique privilege of being able to commute to and from Washington every voting day allowing me to hear directly from Marylanders on a whole host of important issues facing our nation. I’m honored to represent Maryland’s Third Congressional District. https://t.co/aHyjN7c3oE

If you are voting by mail your ballot must be postmarked on or before November 3. You can also drop off your mail ballot at a drop box location by 8:00 PM on November 3.  See here for a list of Ballot Drop Box Locations: https://t.co/QH6K9PjOMB

Please note that in Maryland you can register to vote or update your voter registration information on Election Day.  You can vote at any voting center in your county of residence. See here for a list of Election Day voting centers: https://t.co/kq3JzXt4p5

🗳️ Early voting begins in Maryland TODAY. It continues through Monday November 2. You can vote at any early voting center in the county you live in from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM.  During early voting you can register to vote or update your voter registration information.
To register in person you must provide proof of your Maryland residency with a MVA-issued driver's license MVA-issued ID card utility bill or other government document. #MDvotes

Ruth Bader Ginsburg.   Inspirational force for equality and justice.   Rest in power.  And now...  We give.  We call.  We write.  We vote.  We WIN!

Dr. King said:  “No work is insignificant. All labor that uplifts humanity has dignity.”    Today we salute America's workers and we thank our unions for lifting up the voices of those on the frontlines who labor everyday to keep us safe and strong.
